instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
threads.message: I replaced 2 times 0005 and same story. Pink screen and square with Apple. Vram is hynix. I didnot remove the glue when I replaced the GPU. Do you remove it?

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
threads.message: Its the Vram unless you replaced a 084 1GB hynix with a 005 chip and didnt change the strap resistors.

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
threads.message: Did not remove the glue.......right. Pull and reball.

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
threads.message: Reball 2 of them and all seems ok. Also before reballing the vram temeprature was too hight. And now it is ok. Did you note temperature issue due to bad vram?

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
threads.message: No, that would be shitty thermal compound or crap between the GPU and heat sink.

threads.title: MBP 2011 is that vram?
